text.value: [es-MX]Indicates that this interval is recently created.
[es-MX]This billing group is able to accept usage data.

[es-MX]This billing group is closed to new usage data and during the next usm.exe Run operation, its state will be changed to [TEXT_INTERVAL_STATE_SOFT_CLOSED] and the Soft Close Event adapters will be run for this interval.

[es-MX]This interval is closed to new usage data and during the next usm.exe Run operation, its state will be changed to [TEXT_INTERVAL_STATE_HARD_CLOSED] and the Hard Close Event adapters will be run for this interval.
[es-MX]No adapter event runs for this interval currently.

[es-MX]This interval is closed to new usage data.

NOTE: Only explicitly set the interval state to Hard Closed as opposed to Hard Close Pending when you wish to prevent the Hard Close Adapters from being run automatically. In this case, you will need to run the Hard Close Adapters manually for this interval.
[es-MX]You are not allowed to Force more than one adapter at a time.

[es-MX]WARNING: This interval has dependencies that cannot be run/reversed at this time.
The only way to continue is to force this particular adapter to ignore the dependencies. Normally it is recommended that you do not continue to force this adapter and instead resolve the issues with adapter dependencies by running/reversing them, including adapters from previous intervals.
[es-MX]Change Default State For Accounts Created In This Interval

[es-MX]Currently any new back-dated accounts will have mappings created for this interval in the 'Open' state and these accounts will accept usage for this interval.

To disallow any new accounts from receiving usage in this interval, please click '[TEXT_INTERVAL_BLOCK_TO_NEW_ACCOUNTS]' below. You would do this once you no longer intend to accept new back dated accounts to be included in billing for this interval.

[es-MX]WARNING: This Interval Is Currently Active.
Normally this interval should not be changed from its 'Open' state until the end date of the interval has passed. Closing this interval prematurely should only be done when it is assured that there is no more usage data for this interval.

[es-MX]This billing group is closed to new usage data.

Setting a billing groups state to [TEXT_INTERVAL_STATE_SOFT_CLOSED] will create adapter instances for this billing group. You will need to run the adapters manually for this billing group since the adapters are not run automatically.
[es-MX]You do not have permission to view this billing group.
[ES-MX] Force the selected adapter(s) to run/reverse without running/reversing any dependencies.
[ES-MX]Because of dependencies, these adapters and checkpoints will also need to be run or cancelled:
[ES-MX]Because of dependencies, these adapters and checkpoints will also need to be reversed or cancelled:
[ES-MX]The missing period for this scheduled adapter is from

[ES-MX].
Proceeding will run this scheduled adapter from when it was last run until
[ES-MX]The adapter is currently marked as 'ReadyToReverse'. The submitted Reverse action will be cancelled.
[ES-MX]The adapter is currently marked as 'ReadyToRun'. The submitted Run action will be cancelled.
[ES-MX]) after this interval, the adapter was not reversed.

[ES-MX]ERROR: One or more of the adapters you selected cannot be run.
One or more of the adapters you selected or their dependencies cannot be run. As a consequence, none of the adapters you selected will be run. Please review the error and click 'OK' to return to the interval and select different adapters or a different action.

[ES-MX]One or more of the adapters you selected cannot be run without additional actions also taking place. Please review the dependencies and click 'Continue' to run the requested adapters and perform any additional actions that may be required.

[ES-MX]ERROR: One or more of the adapters you selected cannot be reversed.
One or more of the adapters you selected or their dependencies cannot be reversed. As a consequence, none of the adapters you selected will be reversed. Please review the error and click 'OK' to return to the interval and select different adapters or a different action.

[ES-MX]One or more of the adapters you selected cannot be reversed without additional actions also taking place. Please review the dependencies and click 'Continue' to reverse the requested adapters and perform any additional actions that may be required.
[ES-MX]You have selected to run the following adapter(s):
[ES-MX]You have selected to reverse the following adapter(s):
[ES-MX]No runs have been associated with this instance.
